text: 8 Mrs. Jennings was a widow with an ample jointure .
text_tokenized: 8 Mrs. Jennings was a widow with an ample jointure .

text: She had only two daughters , both of whom she had lived to see respectably married , and she had now therefore nothing to do but to marry all the rest of the world .
text_tokenized: She had only two daughters , both of whom she had lived to see respectably married , and she had now therefore nothing to do but to marry all the rest of the world .

text: In the promotion of this object she was zealously active , as far as her ability reached ; and missed no opportunity of projecting weddings among all the young people of her acquaintance .
text_tokenized: In the promotion of this object she was zealously active , as far as her ability reached ; and missed no opportunity of projecting weddings among all the young people of her acquaintance .

text: She was remarkably quick in the discovery of attachments , and had enjoyed the advantage of raising the blushes and the vanity of many a young lady by insinuations of her power over such a young man ; and this kind of discernment enabled her soon after her arrival at Barton decisively to pronounce that Colonel Brandon was very much in love with Marianne Dashwood .
text_tokenized: She was remarkably quick in the discovery of attachments , and had enjoyed the advantage of raising the blushes and the vanity of many a young lady by insinuations of her power over such a young man ; and this kind of discernment enabled her soon after her arrival at Barton decisively to pronounce that Colonel Brandon was very much in love with Marianne Dashwood .

text: She rather suspected it to be so , on the very first evening of their being together , from his listening so attentively while she sang to them ; and when the visit was returned by the Middletons ' dining at the cottage , the fact was ascertained by his listening to her again . It must be so .
text_tokenized: She rather suspected it to be so , on the very first evening of their being together , from his listening so attentively while she sang to them ; and when the visit was returned by the Middletons ' dining at the cottage , the fact was ascertained by his listening to her again . It must be so .

text: She was perfectly convinced of it .
text_tokenized: She was perfectly convinced of it .

text: It would be an excellent match , for HE was rich , and SHE was handsome .
text_tokenized: It would be an excellent match , for HE was rich , and SHE was handsome .

text: Mrs. Jennings had been anxious to see Colonel Brandon well married , ever since her connection with Sir John first brought him to her knowledge ; and she was always anxious to get a good husband for every pretty girl .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Jennings had been anxious to see Colonel Brandon well married , ever since her connection with Sir John first brought him to her knowledge ; and she was always anxious to get a good husband for every pretty girl .

text: The immediate advantage to herself was by no means inconsiderable , for it supplied her with endless jokes against them both .
text_tokenized: The immediate advantage to herself was by no means inconsiderable , for it supplied her with endless jokes against them both .

text: At the park she laughed at the colonel , and in the cottage at Marianne .
text_tokenized: At the park she laughed at the colonel , and in the cottage at Marianne .

text: To the former her raillery was probably , as far as it regarded only himself , perfectly indifferent ; but to the latter it was at first incomprehensible ; and when its object was understood , she hardly knew whether most to laugh at its absurdity , or censure its impertinence , for she considered it as an unfeeling reflection on the colonel 's advanced years , and on his forlorn condition as an old bachelor .
text_tokenized: To the former her raillery was probably , as far as it regarded only himself , perfectly indifferent ; but to the latter it was at first incomprehensible ; and when its object was understood , she hardly knew whether most to laugh at its absurdity , or censure its impertinence , for she considered it as an unfeeling reflection on the colonel 's advanced years , and on his forlorn condition as an old bachelor .

text: Mrs. Dashwood , who could not think a man five years younger than herself , so exceedingly ancient as he appeared to the youthful fancy of her daughter , ventured to clear Mrs. Jennings from the probability of wishing to throw ridicule on his age .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Dashwood , who could not think a man five years younger than herself , so exceedingly ancient as he appeared to the youthful fancy of her daughter , ventured to clear Mrs. Jennings from the probability of wishing to throw ridicule on his age .

text: " But at least , Mamma , you can not deny the absurdity of the accusation , though you may not think it intentionally ill - natured .
text_tokenized: " But at least , Mamma , you can not deny the absurdity of the accusation , though you may not think it intentionally ill - natured .

text: Colonel Brandon is certainly younger than Mrs. Jennings , but he is old enough to be MY father ; and if he were ever animated enough to be in love , must have long outlived every sensation of the kind .
text_tokenized: Colonel Brandon is certainly younger than Mrs. Jennings , but he is old enough to be MY father ; and if he were ever animated enough to be in love , must have long outlived every sensation of the kind .

text: It is too ridiculous !
text_tokenized: It is too ridiculous !

text: When is a man to be safe from such wit , if age and infirmity will not protect him ? " " Infirmity ! " said Elinor , " do you call Colonel Brandon infirm ?
text_tokenized: When is a man to be safe from such wit , if age and infirmity will not protect him ? " " Infirmity ! " said Elinor , " do you call Colonel Brandon infirm ?

text: I can easily suppose that his age may appear much greater to you than to my mother ; but you can hardly deceive yourself as to his having the use of his limbs !
text_tokenized: I can easily suppose that his age may appear much greater to you than to my mother ; but you can hardly deceive yourself as to his having the use of his limbs !

text: " Did not you hear him complain of the rheumatism ?
text_tokenized: " Did not you hear him complain of the rheumatism ?

text: and is not that the commonest infirmity of declining life ? " " My dearest child , " said her mother , laughing , " at this rate you must be in continual terror of MY decay ; and it must seem to you a miracle that my life has been extended to the advanced age of forty .
text_tokenized: and is not that the commonest infirmity of declining life ? " " My dearest child , " said her mother , laughing , " at this rate you must be in continual terror of MY decay ; and it must seem to you a miracle that my life has been extended to the advanced age of forty .

text: " Mamma , you are not doing me justice .
text_tokenized: " Mamma , you are not doing me justice .

text: I know very well that Colonel Brandon is not old enough to make his friends yet apprehensive of losing him in the course of nature .
text_tokenized: I know very well that Colonel Brandon is not old enough to make his friends yet apprehensive of losing him in the course of nature .

text: He may live twenty years longer .
text_tokenized: He may live twenty years longer .

text: But thirty - five has nothing to do with matrimony .
text_tokenized: But thirty - five has nothing to do with matrimony .

text: " " Perhaps , " said Elinor , " thirty - five and seventeen had better not have any thing to do with matrimony together .
text_tokenized: " " Perhaps , " said Elinor , " thirty - five and seventeen had better not have any thing to do with matrimony together .

text: But if there should by any chance happen to be a woman who is single at seven and twenty , I should not think Colonel Brandon 's being thirty - five any objection to his marrying HER .
text_tokenized: But if there should by any chance happen to be a woman who is single at seven and twenty , I should not think Colonel Brandon 's being thirty - five any objection to his marrying HER .

text: " " A woman of seven and twenty , " said Marianne , after pausing a moment , " can never hope to feel or inspire affection again , and if her home be uncomfortable , or her fortune small , I can suppose that she might bring herself to submit to the offices of a nurse , for the sake of the provision and security of a wife . In his marrying such a woman therefore there would be nothing unsuitable .
text_tokenized: " " A woman of seven and twenty , " said Marianne , after pausing a moment , " can never hope to feel or inspire affection again , and if her home be uncomfortable , or her fortune small , I can suppose that she might bring herself to submit to the offices of a nurse , for the sake of the provision and security of a wife . In his marrying such a woman therefore there would be nothing unsuitable .

text: It would be a compact of convenience , and the world would be satisfied . In my eyes it would be no marriage at all , but that would be nothing .
text_tokenized: It would be a compact of convenience , and the world would be satisfied . In my eyes it would be no marriage at all , but that would be nothing .

text: To me it would seem only a commercial exchange , in which each wished to be benefited at the expense of the other .
text_tokenized: To me it would seem only a commercial exchange , in which each wished to be benefited at the expense of the other .

text: " " It would be impossible , I know , " replied Elinor , " to convince you that a woman of seven and twenty could feel for a man of thirty - five anything near enough to love , to make him a desirable companion to her .
text_tokenized: " " It would be impossible , I know , " replied Elinor , " to convince you that a woman of seven and twenty could feel for a man of thirty - five anything near enough to love , to make him a desirable companion to her .

text: But I must object to your dooming Colonel Brandon and his wife to the constant confinement of a sick chamber , merely because he chanced to complain yesterday ( a very cold damp day ) of a slight rheumatic feel in one of his shoulders .
text_tokenized: But I must object to your dooming Colonel Brandon and his wife to the constant confinement of a sick chamber , merely because he chanced to complain yesterday ( a very cold damp day ) of a slight rheumatic feel in one of his shoulders .

text: " " But he talked of flannel waistcoats , " said Marianne ; " and with me a flannel waistcoat is invariably connected with aches , cramps , rheumatisms , and every species of ailment that can afflict the old and the feeble . "
text_tokenized: " " But he talked of flannel waistcoats , " said Marianne ; " and with me a flannel waistcoat is invariably connected with aches , cramps , rheumatisms , and every species of ailment that can afflict the old and the feeble . "

text: " Had he been only in a violent fever , you would not have despised him half so much .
text_tokenized: " Had he been only in a violent fever , you would not have despised him half so much .

text: Confess , Marianne , is not there something interesting to you in the flushed cheek , hollow eye , and quick pulse of a fever ?
text_tokenized: Confess , Marianne , is not there something interesting to you in the flushed cheek , hollow eye , and quick pulse of a fever ?

text: Soon after this , upon Elinor 's leaving the room , " Mamma , " said Marianne , " I have an alarm on the subject of illness which I can not conceal from you .
text_tokenized: Soon after this , upon Elinor 's leaving the room , " Mamma , " said Marianne , " I have an alarm on the subject of illness which I can not conceal from you .

text: I am sure Edward Ferrars is not well .
text_tokenized: I am sure Edward Ferrars is not well .

text: We have now been here almost a fortnight , and yet he does not come .
text_tokenized: We have now been here almost a fortnight , and yet he does not come .

text: Nothing but real indisposition could occasion this extraordinary delay . What else can detain him at Norland ? " " Had you any idea of his coming so soon ? " said Mrs. Dashwood .
text_tokenized: Nothing but real indisposition could occasion this extraordinary delay . What else can detain him at Norland ? " " Had you any idea of his coming so soon ? " said Mrs. Dashwood .

text: " I had none .
text_tokenized: " I had none .

text: On the contrary , if I have felt any anxiety at all on the subject , it has been in recollecting that he sometimes showed a want of pleasure and readiness in accepting my invitation , when I talked of his coming to Barton .
text_tokenized: On the contrary , if I have felt any anxiety at all on the subject , it has been in recollecting that he sometimes showed a want of pleasure and readiness in accepting my invitation , when I talked of his coming to Barton .

text: Does Elinor expect him already ?
text_tokenized: Does Elinor expect him already ?

text: " I have never mentioned it to her , but of course she must . " "
text_tokenized: " I have never mentioned it to her , but of course she must . " "

text: I rather think you are mistaken , for when I was talking to her yesterday of getting a new grate for the spare bedchamber , she observed that there was no immediate hurry for it , as it was not likely that the room would be wanted for some time .
text_tokenized: I rather think you are mistaken , for when I was talking to her yesterday of getting a new grate for the spare bedchamber , she observed that there was no immediate hurry for it , as it was not likely that the room would be wanted for some time .

text: " How strange this is ! what can be the meaning of it ! But the whole of their behaviour to each other has been unaccountable !
text_tokenized: " How strange this is ! what can be the meaning of it ! But the whole of their behaviour to each other has been unaccountable !

text: How cold , how composed were their last adieus !
text_tokenized: How cold , how composed were their last adieus !

text: How languid their conversation the last evening of their being together !
text_tokenized: How languid their conversation the last evening of their being together !

text: In Edward 's farewell there was no distinction between Elinor and me : it was the good wishes of an affectionate brother to both .
text_tokenized: In Edward 's farewell there was no distinction between Elinor and me : it was the good wishes of an affectionate brother to both .

text: Twice did I leave them purposely together in the course of the last morning ,
text_tokenized: Twice did I leave them purposely together in the course of the last morning ,

text: and each time did he most unaccountably follow me out of the room . And Elinor , in quitting Norland and Edward , cried not as I did . Even now her self - command is invariable .
text_tokenized: and each time did he most unaccountably follow me out of the room . And Elinor , in quitting Norland and Edward , cried not as I did . Even now her self - command is invariable .

text: When is she dejected or melancholy ?
text_tokenized: When is she dejected or melancholy ?

text: When does she try to avoid society , or appear restless and dissatisfied in it ? "

text: 9 The Dashwoods were now settled at Barton with tolerable comfort to themselves .
text_tokenized: 9 The Dashwoods were now settled at Barton with tolerable comfort to themselves .

text: The house and the garden , with all the objects surrounding them , were now become familiar , and the ordinary pursuits which had given to Norland half its charms were engaged in again with far greater enjoyment than Norland had been able to afford , since the loss of their father . Sir John Middleton , who called on them every day for the first fortnight , and who was not in the habit of seeing much occupation at home , could not conceal his amazement on finding them always employed .
text_tokenized: The house and the garden , with all the objects surrounding them , were now become familiar , and the ordinary pursuits which had given to Norland half its charms were engaged in again with far greater enjoyment than Norland had been able to afford , since the loss of their father . Sir John Middleton , who called on them every day for the first fortnight , and who was not in the habit of seeing much occupation at home , could not conceal his amazement on finding them always employed .

text: Their visitors , except those from Barton Park , were not many ; for , in spite of Sir John 's urgent entreaties that they would mix more in the neighbourhood , and repeated assurances of his carriage being always at their service , the independence of Mrs. Dashwood 's spirit overcame the wish of society for her children ; and she was resolute in declining to visit any family beyond the distance of a walk . There were but few who could be so classed ; and it was not all of them that were attainable . About a mile and a half from the cottage , along the narrow winding valley of Allenham , which issued from that of Barton , as formerly described , the girls had , in one of their earliest walks , discovered an ancient respectable looking mansion which , by reminding them a little of Norland , interested their imagination and made them wish to be better acquainted with it .

There were but few who could be so classed ; and it was not all of them that were attainable . About a mile and a half from the cottage , along the narrow winding valley of Allenham , which issued from that of Barton , as formerly described , the girls had , in one of their earliest walks , discovered an ancient respectable looking mansion which , by reminding them a little of Norland , interested their imagination and made them wish to be better acquainted with it .

text: But they learnt , on enquiry , that its possessor , an elderly lady of very good character , was unfortunately too infirm to mix with the world , and never stirred from home .
text_tokenized: But they learnt , on enquiry , that its possessor , an elderly lady of very good character , was unfortunately too infirm to mix with the world , and never stirred from home .

text: The whole country about them abounded in beautiful walks .
text_tokenized: The whole country about them abounded in beautiful walks .

text: The high downs which invited them from almost every window of the cottage to seek the exquisite enjoyment of air on their summits , were a happy alternative when the dirt of the valleys beneath shut up their superior beauties ; and towards one of these hills did Marianne and Margaret one memorable morning direct their steps , attracted by the partial sunshine of a showery sky , and unable longer to bear the confinement which the settled rain of the two preceding days had occasioned .

text: would be lastingly fair , and that every threatening cloud would be drawn off from their hills ;

text: and the two girls set off together . They gaily ascended the downs , rejoicing in their own penetration at every glimpse of blue sky ; and when they caught in their faces the animating gales of a high south - westerly wind , they pitied the fears which had prevented their mother and Elinor from sharing such delightful sensations .

text: " Is there a felicity in the world , " said Marianne , " superior to this?--Margaret , we will walk here at least two hours . "
text_tokenized: " Is there a felicity in the world , " said Marianne , " superior to this?--Margaret , we will walk here at least two hours . "

text: Margaret agreed , and they pursued their way against the wind , resisting it with laughing delight for about twenty minutes longer , when suddenly the clouds united over their heads , and a driving rain set full in their face.-- Chagrined and surprised , they were obliged , though unwillingly , to turn back , for no shelter was nearer than their own house .

text: One consolation however remained for them , to which the exigence of the moment gave more than usual propriety ; it was that of running with all possible speed down the steep side of the hill which led immediately to their garden gate .
text_tokenized: One consolation however remained for them , to which the exigence of the moment gave more than usual propriety ; it was that of running with all possible speed down the steep side of the hill which led immediately to their garden gate .

text: They set off .
text_tokenized: They set off .

text: Marianne had at first the advantage , but a false step brought her suddenly to the ground ; and Margaret , unable to stop herself to assist her , was involuntarily hurried along , and reached the bottom in safety . A gentleman carrying a gun , with two pointers playing round him , was passing up the hill and within a few yards of Marianne , when her accident happened .
text_tokenized: Marianne had at first the advantage , but a false step brought her suddenly to the ground ; and Margaret , unable to stop herself to assist her , was involuntarily hurried along , and reached the bottom in safety . A gentleman carrying a gun , with two pointers playing round him , was passing up the hill and within a few yards of Marianne , when her accident happened .

text: He put down his gun and ran to her assistance . She had raised herself from the ground , but her foot had been twisted in her fall , and she was scarcely able to stand .
text_tokenized: He put down his gun and ran to her assistance . She had raised herself from the ground , but her foot had been twisted in her fall , and she was scarcely able to stand .

text: The gentleman offered his services ; and perceiving that her modesty declined what her situation rendered necessary , took her up in his arms without farther delay , and carried her down the hill . Then passing through the garden , the gate of which had been left open by Margaret , he bore her directly into the house , whither Margaret was just arrived , and quitted not his hold till he had seated her in a chair in the parlour . Elinor and her mother rose up in amazement at their entrance , and while the eyes of both were fixed on him with an evident wonder and a secret admiration which equally sprung from his appearance , he apologized for his intrusion by relating its cause , in a manner so frank and so graceful that his person , which was uncommonly handsome , received additional charms from his voice and expression .

text: His name , he replied , was Willoughby , and his present home was at Allenham , from whence he hoped she would allow him the honour of calling tomorrow to enquire after Miss Dashwood .
text_tokenized: His name , he replied , was Willoughby , and his present home was at Allenham , from whence he hoped she would allow him the honour of calling tomorrow to enquire after Miss Dashwood .

text: The honour was readily granted , and he then departed , to make himself still more interesting , in the midst of a heavy rain . His manly beauty and more than common gracefulness were instantly the theme of general admiration , and the laugh which his gallantry raised against Marianne received particular spirit from his exterior attractions.-- Marianne herself had seen less of his person that the rest , for the confusion which crimsoned over her face , on his lifting her up , had robbed her of the power of regarding him after their entering the house . But she had seen enough of him to join in all the admiration of the others , and with an energy which always adorned her praise . His person and air were equal to what her fancy had ever drawn for the hero of a favourite story ; and in his carrying her into the house with so little previous formality , there was a rapidity of thought which particularly recommended the action to her .

text: On this point Sir John could give more certain intelligence ; and he told them that Mr. Willoughby had no property of his own in the country ; that he resided there only while he was visiting the old lady at Allenham Court , to whom he was related , and whose possessions he was to inherit ; adding , " Yes , yes , he is very well worth catching I can tell you , Miss Dashwood ; he has a pretty little estate of his own in Somersetshire besides ; and if I were you , I would not give him up to my younger sister , in spite of all this tumbling down hills . Miss Marianne must not expect to have all the men to herself .

text: I am glad to find , however , from what you say , that he is a respectable young man , and one whose acquaintance will not be ineligible .

text: " " He is as good a sort of fellow , I believe , as ever lived , " repeated Sir John .

text: " I remember last Christmas at a little hop at the park , he danced from eight o'clock till four , without once sitting down .

text: " Yes ; and he was up again at eight to ride to covert . " " That is what I like ; that is what a young man ought to be .

text: " That is an expression , Sir John , " said Marianne , warmly , " which I particularly dislike .

text: I abhor every common - place phrase by which wit is intended ; and ' setting one 's cap at a man , ' or ' making a conquest , ' are the most odious of all .
